project.name: Eve Ship Comparator API
project.description: A set of classes for interacting with Eve Online ship data.

esc-select.name: esc-select
esc-select.description: A tool to make it easier to build complex SQL queries.

esc-hp-pool.name: esc-hp-pool
esc-hp-pool.description: Objects, classes, and methods related to hit point pools for ships in Eve Online. Includes calculating EHP based on a number of strategies (EFT, and CCP's own calculations) and different damage profiles (Gursita, Amarr, Serpentis, etc.).

esc-skill.name: esc-skill
esc-skill.description: Classes and objects having to do with skill requirements for ships.

esc-promise.name: esc-promise
esc-promise.description:
Wraps the execution of asynchronous operations, providing a promise object that
can be used to subscribe to the various ways the operation may terminate.

When the operation completes successfully, call the Resolver's `fulfill()`
method, passing any relevant response data for subscribers.  If the operation
encounters an error or is unsuccessful in some way, call `reject()`, again
passing any relevant data for subscribers.

The Resolver object should be shared only with the code resposible for
resolving or rejecting it. Public access for the Resolver is through its
_promise_, which is returned from the Resolver's `promise` property. While both
Resolver and promise allow subscriptions to the Resolver's state changes, the
promise may be exposed to non-controlling code. It is the preferable interface
for adding subscriptions.

Subscribe to state changes in the Resolver with the promise's
`then(callback, errback)` method.  `then()` wraps the passed callbacks in a
new Resolver and returns the corresponding promise, allowing chaining of
asynchronous or synchronous operations. E.g.
`promise.then(someAsyncFunc).then(anotherAsyncFunc)`

esc.util.Criteria.name: esc.util.Criteria
esc.util.Criteria.description: A criteria object generates a set of conditionals to be attached to a SQL query. Criteria objects are usually generated from Select instances using the `where` method, but can be generated on its own, if that level of control is needed.

params.name: criteria
params.description: If the `criteria` argument is a string, it sets the column the criteria is looking at, so that it can be followed by a call to `is`, `gt`, `lt`, or `like`. If the criteria argument is a function, it will evaluate the function against provided arguments when the criteria is evaluated. If the criteria is a `Criteria` instance, it attaches that. This last case is useful for attaching tree-based criteria to a query.

params.name: parentCriteria
params.description: Criteria objects exist in a linked list. If the parentCriteria is defined, it will be set as the previous link in the list.

params.name: selectStatement
params.description: The containing select statement.

esc.util.Select.name: esc.util.Select
esc.util.Select.description: Generates a new select statement that can be evaluated using `exec`. Generally accessed via the `from` factory method.
example:
select.from({ 'invTypes': [ 'typeID', 'typeName' ] }).where('typeID').is('{id}').exec({ id: 12345 });
    // SELECT invTypes.typeID, invTypes.typeName FROM invTypes WHERE typeID == 12345

esc.model.DamageProfile.name: esc.model.DamageProfile
esc.model.DamageProfile.description: A utility class that generates an EHP based on a provided HpPool instance.

params.name: cfg
params.description:
A configuration object that accepts the following properties:

* **em** - The proportion of EM damage.
* **explosive** - The proportion of explosive damage.
* **kinetic** - The proportion of kinetic damage.
* **thermal** - The proportion of thermal damage.

If the sum of all four damage levels is greater than 1, they will all be normalized in relation to each other to enforce a total value of 1.

For example, passing `{ em: 1, explosive: 1, kinetic: 1, thermal: 1 }` will normalize each value to `0.25`.

The damage profiles defined as static properties on this object are taken from this site:
<http://eve-survival.org/wikka.php?wakka=TankingGuide>

esc.model.HpPool.name: esc.model.HpPool
esc.model.HpPool.description: Represents one of the three HP 'pools' on a ship: shields, armor, and structure (hull)

esc.model.Shield.name: esc.model.Shield
esc.model.Shield.description: A descendant of the HpPool object that has additional features related to shield rechage rates.

esc.model.Sensors.name: esc.model.Sensors
esc.model.Sensors.description: A set of properties related to sensor strength, range, and max locked targets.

esc.model.Heat.name: esc.model.Heat
esc.model.Heat.description: Properties related to how a ship generates and sheds heat.

esc.model.Capacity.name: esc.model.Capacity
esc.model.Capacity.description: Properties related to how much junk a ship can hold.

esc.model.Slots.name: esc.model.Slots
esc.model.Slots.description: Properties related to how many modules a ship can be fitted with.

esc.model.Drones.name: esc.model.Drones
esc.model.Drones.description: A set of properties related to ship drone capacity and bandwidth.

esc.model.JumpDrive.name: esc.model.JumpDrive
esc.model.JumpDrive.description: A set of properties related to ship Jump Drives.

esc.model.Capacitor.name: esc.model.Capacitor
esc.model.Capacitor.description: A set of properties related to the size and charge rate of the capacitor.

params.name: cfg
params.description: An object literal describing a ship.

esc.model.Skill.name: esc.model.Skill
esc.model.Skill.description: A representation of a skill in the Eve skill tree. Matains a list of skills that are required to train this skill, as well as things like group, rank, and description.

esc.model.SkillRequirement.name: esc.model.SkillRequirement
esc.model.SkillRequirement.description: A representation of a required skill, either to fly a ship or as a prereq for a skill to fly a ship.

esc.util.Promise.name: esc.util.Promise
esc.util.Promise.description:
The public API for a Resolver. Used to subscribe to the notification events for
resolution or progress of the operation represented by the Resolver.

params.name: fn
params.description:
A function where to insert the logic that resolves this
promise. Receives `fulfill` and `reject` functions as parameters

esc.util.Promise.Resolver.name: esc.util.Promise.Resolver
esc.util.Promise.Resolver.description:
Represents an asynchronous operation. Provides a
standard API for subscribing to the moment that the operation completes either
successfully (`fulfill()`) or unsuccessfully (`reject()`).

params.name: promise
params.description: The promise instance this resolver will be handling

classitems.description: The parent criteria for this instance.

classitems.description: The child criteria for this instance.
classitems.name: child

classitems.description: The parent select statement.
classitems.name: parentSelect

classitems.description: Returns the select statement that this criteria is a part of, if one exists. If this Critiera doesn't know what select statement it is a part of, it will traverse the criteria tree until it finds it.
classitems.name: select

return.description: The parent select object, if any.

classitems.description: Adds a child criteria to the linked list and returns it. Used for fluent chaining.

classitems.name: and

classitems.description: Adds a new `OR` child criteria and returns it.

classitems.description: Adds a predicate to the current criteria.

classitems.name: exec

classitems.name: from

classitems.description: Returns a new Criteria clause attached to this select statement.
classitems.name: where

return.description: The first item on the criteria chain.

classitems.description: A factory method for Select
classitems.name: exec

A query promise hooked to this instance's db.

classitems.description: The damage profile used by the in-game fitting tool. CCP uses a different strategy, they use the weakest of a pool's four resists to generate the EHP.
classitems.name: eve

classitems.description: HpPools will fall back to this damage profile if no damageProfile is provided to the instance. Defaults to the EFT profile.
classitems.name: sharedDamageProfile

classitems.description:
The effective hit points of this damage pool, typically calculated by:

`EHP = HP / (1-RST)`

Where 'HP` is the pool size and `RST` is the average damage resistance against the four damage types.

Source: <http://community.eveonline.com/ingameboard.asp?a=topic&threadID=780756>
classitems.name: ehp

classitems.description: The amount of time it takes for the shield to go from fully discharged to fully charged in seconds.
classitems.name: recharge

classitems.description:
The peak recharge rate of a shield is defined by:

`R = 2.4 * S / R`

Where `R` is the recharge rate, `S` is the maximum shield size, and `R` is the recharge rate in seconds.

Source: <http://wiki.eveonline.com/en/wiki/Shield_recharge>
classitems.name: peakRecharge

classitems.description: Returns the highest of the radar strengths, since each ship really only has one radar strength type.
classitems.name: strength

classitems.description: The maximum amount of charge the capacitor can hold.
classitems.name: capacity

classitems.description: The time it takes to go from fully discharged to fully charged in seconds.
classitems.name: recharge

classitems.description:
A read-only synthetic property that's the peak recharge rate of a capacitor.
    
The peak recharge of a capacitor appears to happen on or near the 25% mark and is defined by:

`dC/dt = ( SQRT( Cx/Cmax ) - C/Cmax ) * 2 * Cmax / tau`

Where:

* `dC/dt` is the amount the capacitor will recharge per second
* `Cx` is the current amount of energy in the capacitor
* `Cmax` is the total amount of energy in a fully-charged capacitor
* `tau` is a constant that's either t/5 or t/4.8 where t is the recharge rate in seconds. (I chose 5) 

Source: <http://wiki.eveonline.com/en/wiki/Capacitor_recharge_rate>
classitems.name: peakRecharge

classitems.description:
The meta-level of the item. Here's a loose collection of values and what they mean:

* 0 - Tech-level 1
* 1-4 - "Named" equipment, not used for ships.
* 5 - Tech-level 2 and 3.
* 6 - Special edition gifts or unusual craft (e.g. the echelon or zephyr)
* 7 - ??
* 8 - Pirate- or Navy-faction.
* 9 - Special
classitems.name: meta

classitems.description:
Schedule execution of a callback to either or both of "fulfill" and
"reject" resolutions for this promise. The callbacks are wrapped in a new
promise and that promise is returned.  This allows operation chaining ala
`functionA().then(functionB).then(functionC)` where `functionA` returns
a promise, and `functionB` and `functionC` _may_ return promises.

Asynchronicity of the callbacks is guaranteed.
classitems.name: then

params.name: callback
params.description:
function to execute if the promise
resolves successfully

params.name: errback
params.description:
function to execute if the promise
resolves unsuccessfully

return.description:
A promise wrapping the resolution of either "resolve" or
"reject" callback

classitems.description:
Returns the current status of the operation. Possible results are
"pending", "fulfilled", and "rejected".
classitems.name: getStatus

classitems.description:
Checks if an object or value is a promise. This is cross-implementation
compatible, so promises returned from other libraries or native components
that are compatible with the Promises A+ spec should be recognized by this
method.
classitems.name: isPromise

params.name: obj
params.description: The object to test

return.description: Whether the object is a promise or not

classitems.description: The promise for this Resolver.
classitems.name: promise

classitems.description: The status of the operation.
classitems.name: _status

classitems.description:
Resolves the promise, signaling successful completion of the
represented operation. All "onFulfilled" subscriptions are executed and passed
the value provided to this method. After calling `fulfill()`, `reject()` and
`notify()` are disabled.
classitems.name: fulfill

params.name: value
params.description: Value to pass along to the "onFulfilled" subscribers

classitems.description:
Resolves the promise, signaling *un*successful completion of the
represented operation. All "onRejected" subscriptions are executed with
the value provided to this method. After calling `reject()`, `resolve()`
and `notify()` are disabled.
classitems.name: reject

params.name: value
params.description: Value to pass along to the "reject" subscribers

classitems.description:
Schedule execution of a callback to either or both of "resolve" and
"reject" resolutions for the Resolver.  The callbacks
are wrapped in a new Resolver and that Resolver's corresponding promise
is returned.  This allows operation chaining ala
`functionA().then(functionB).then(functionC)` where `functionA` returns
a promise, and `functionB` and `functionC` _may_ return promises.
classitems.name: then

params.name: callback
params.description:
function to execute if the Resolver
resolves successfully

params.name: errback
params.description:
function to execute if the Resolver
resolves unsuccessfully

return.description:
The promise of a new Resolver wrapping the resolution
of either "resolve" or "reject" callback

classitems.description:
Returns the current status of the Resolver as a string "pending",
"fulfilled", or "rejected".
classitems.name: getStatus

classitems.description:
Returns the result of the Resolver.  Use `getStatus()` to test that the
promise is fulfilled before calling this.
classitems.name: getResult

classitems.description:
Executes an array of callbacks from a specified context, passing a set of
arguments.
classitems.name: _notify

params.name: subs
params.description: The array of subscriber callbacks

params.name: result
params.description: Value to pass the callbacks
